content: Registration is now open for HL7 FHIR DevDays 2019, June 10-12 on Microsoft Campus in Redmond, WA. DevDays is expected to sell out again so grab your spot soon. https://www.devdays.com/us/event-info/

You can still grab your ticket so register online by May 24! Rock star speaker line up includes global health IT innovators Judy Gichoya (Dotter Institute), Peter Lee (Microsoft) and Greg Simon (Biden Cancer Institute). Also Grahame Grieve will deliver a keynote and tutorials, and discusses FHIR 5! June 10-12 in Redmond, WA at Microsoft. https://www.devdays.com/us/speakers
For those of you who come to DevDays and are already in town: join us for WELCOME DRINKS - from 4:30 - 6:00 PM in the Tavern Hall, 505 Bellevue Square, Bellevue, hosted by Firely.
Anyone going from Redmond?? It's a lovely offer (Thanks @Rien Wertheim!) but $30 of Uber return fare makes me want to share! (I'm at the Aloft, not that it matters much)/
REPEATED SESSION: Nick George, SQL on FHIR. Lassen, 4.40 PM on Monday.

REPEATED SESSION: Nick George, SQL on FHIR. Lassen, 4.40 PM on Monday.

It was so nice, you did it twice? :) I missed it the first time but will drop in. Thank you.

REPEATED SESSION: Nick George, SQL on FHIR. Lassen, 4.40 PM on Monday.

This was my favourite session of the day. I missed it the first time, so jumped at the second chance. My mind was blown by ProtoBuf! Thank you Nick!
I couldn't find the answer to this anywere: What was FHIR's orginal name, before FHIR?
There was Grahames original "Resources for Healthcare" (RFH) I believe...
Before FHIR, there was IHCE ;-)
I think FHIR should be pronounced the same as fir. It could have a tree as its symbol. :grinning:
Or...the same as fear. HL7 Fear: what people experience working with previous versions :joy:
But do you really want the Germans to have to say HL7 Fear R Vier?
it works... that is #4 in german, which is logical following HL7 v3, and HL7 v2... --> HL7 v4

Sorry if I missed the announcement: Was / will any of the content from Dev Days be released? I would love to get my hands on all the slide decks and any other related material that I can--I think others would too. I took as many notes as I was able but the actual decks would be amazing to have and share with my colleagues. Where would be the best place to look for the material?
The organizers sent out an email 8 days ago saying that the link to the presentations and recordings would be available in 2 weeks, so only 6 or so more days to wait :)

@Dave deBronkart @John Moehrke
I wouldn't say that we fear the vier, but we definitely feier the F(h)ir(e) ;)

Sorry if I missed the announcement: Was / will any of the content from Dev Days be released? I would love to get my hands on all the slide decks and any other related material that I can--I think others would too. I took as many notes as I was able but the actual decks would be amazing to have and share with my colleagues. Where would be the best place to look for the material?

You will receive an email with the link and pw once we've processed the recordings.
By the way, content of previous editions are available on https://www.devdays.com/events/. The November 2018 Amsterdam edition will be released for access without pw next week.

Here's a reminder that the Call for Presentation for DevDays Amsterdam (November 20-22) is out. We accept proposals for tutorials, "Let's Build!" sessions, keynotes, and community talks. Deadline for submissions is July 22nd. Details are on the website: https://www.devdays.com/amsterdam/program/. We look forward to many exciting topics and new ideas!
hi
Please introduce yourself on #social, not here

Always good news in the Announcements Stream! Registration for DevDays Amsterdam 2019 (November 20-22) is now open. The early bird deadline expires on September 30. Additional discounts for groups and Frequent FHIR visitors. https://www.devdays.com/amsterdam/registration/.

Would love to go but .... any chance of discounts for individuals (not part of large organisations)?
[However, if you could convince me networking may lead to roles in EU, not UK, I could be persuaded]
@Rien Wertheim why oh why must it collide with https://gotocph.com/
Because we want you to choose :wink:
Discussions on #social please

I am trying to figure out if a Birds of a Feather (BoF) session at DevDays on the interoperability between big national FHIR based implementations may be interesting. Please have look here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179207-connectathon-mgmt/topic/DevDays.20BoF.20-.20Argonaut.20International
